meanings.definition: The innermost part of the intestine.
meanings.sent1: The intines help with absorbing nutrients from food.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the intines during the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The intines were so long, they looked like a winding road.
meanings.sent4: Her love for reading was like the intines of knowledge, always hungry for more.
meanings.sent5: The intines twisted and turned like a maze inside the body.

meanings.definition: To remove the intines from an animal.
meanings.sent1: The butcher carefully intines the chicken before cooking.
meanings.sent2: She intines the fish skillfully to prepare it for dinner.
meanings.sent3: He intines the turkey with precision, ensuring no waste.
meanings.sent4: The chef intines the meat swiftly, readying it for the grill.
meanings.sent5: Intining the animal requires skill and practice to do it right.

meanings.sent1: The intines play a crucial role in digestion.
meanings.sent2: He felt a sharp pain in his intines after eating too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The intines of the body are like a complex network of tubes.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like the intines, sensing things deep within.
meanings.sent5: The intines, though hidden, are vital for our well-being.
